intro: Corydalis tarkiensis, commonly known as the Tibetan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Tibet and adjacent regions. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred petals and clusters of small, colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branching. Corydalis tarkiensis is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its potential medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
